intro: Elatostema brunonianum, commonly known as the broadleaf elatostema, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows as a low shrub or herb, thriving in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Elatostema brunonianum is native to regions in Southeast Asia and is often found in forest understories.
